required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on August 12, 2022
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: COVID-19 Convalescent Plasma for the Treatment of Hospitalized Patients With Pneumonia Caused by SARS-CoV-2.
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Controlled, Phase 1, Safety and Exploratory Efficacy Study of Convalescent Plasma for Severely Ill, Hospitalized Participants With COVID-19 Pneumonia Caused by SARS-CoV-2.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see if this plasma can be safely used in humans with COVID-19 and to see if it improves patients' health as compared to not using it in patients with pneumonia caused by SARS-CoV-2.

detailed_description.textblock:
This open-label, randomized, controlled, phase 1 trial will assess the safety and efficacy of convalescent plasma in severely ill, hospitalized participants with pneumonia due to COVID-19. This study will enroll adults 18 years old and older, including pregnant women.
A total of 80 eligible participants will be randomized to receive either 2 units of convalescent plasma collected from ABO-compatible donors who have recovered from COVID-19 and standard of care (treatment arm) or standard of care alone (control arm). Participants in the treatment arm will receive 2 units of convalescent plasma on Study Day 1 in addition to standard of care.
Participants will be assessed on study Day 1 (pre-dose), 30 minutes after each unit of plasma, on all Study Days while hospitalized, and Study Days 15, 22, 29, and 60. All participants will undergo a series of safety and efficacy, assessments. Blood samples will be collected on Days 1 (prior to plasma administration), 3, 8, 15, 29, and 60. Oropharyngeal or endotracheal samples will be collected on Days 1 (prior to plasma administration), 3, 5, 8, 11, and 15.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants will be randomized 1:1 to receive either convalescent plasma on Study Day 1 in addition to standard care or standard care alone.

primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with at least one serious adverse events (SAEs) up to Study Day 29.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Status Assessment, Time to Recovery
National Early Warning Score (NEWS) Clinical Status Assessment
secondary_outcome.description: Time to discharge or to a National Early Warning Score (NEWS) of â‰¤ 2 and maintained for 24 hours, whichever occurs first. NEWS assessed daily while hospitalized until discharge or death and on Days 15 and 29. Higher NEWS is worse, range from 0 to 20.

secondary_outcome.measure: Oxygenation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily while hospitalized and up to Study Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Days of supplemental oxygen while in hospital. defined as days with WHO8 ordinal score of 5, 6, or 7

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of New Oxygenation Use up to Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of new oxygenation use up to Day 29.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of New Oxygen Use up to Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Duration (days) of new oxygen use up to Day 29.

secondary_outcome.measure: Non-invasive Ventilation/High Flow Oxygen Days up to Day 29
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily while in hospital to Study Day 29.
secondary_outcome.description: Days of non-invasive ventilation/high flow oxygen up to Day 29 Defined by having a WHO8 ordinal scale of 6 = Hospitalized, on non-invasive ventilation or high flow oxygen devices

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With at Least One Day on Non-invasive Ventilation/High Flow Oxygen up to Day 29
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily while in hospital until Study Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: number of participants with at least one day on non-invasive ventilation/high flow oxygen Defined by having a WHO8 ordinal scale of 6 = Hospitalized, on non-invasive ventilation or high flow oxygen devices

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Non-invasive Ventilation/High Flow Oxygen up to Day 29
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily while in hospital to Study Day 29.
secondary_outcome.description: Days of non-invasive ventilation/high flow oxygen up to Day 29

secondary_outcome.measure: Ventilator/ECMO Days to Day 29
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily while in hospital to Study Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Days of mechanical ventilation or ECMO use (having a WHO8 ordinal score of 7 = Hospitalized, on invasive mechanical ventilation or ECMO) during the study in hospital until study day 29.

secondary_outcome.measure: New Mechanical Ventilation or ECMO Use
secondary_outcome.description: number of subjects with new mechanical ventilation or ECMO use up to Day 29 since all subjects were not on mechanical ventilation or ECMO at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of New Mechanical Ventilation or ECMO
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily while in hospital to Study Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Days of new mechanical ventilation or ECMO use up to Day 29.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Duration (days) of first hospitalization. Time until death or discharge or Study Day 29

secondary_outcome.measure: Mortality
secondary_outcome.description: 28 day mortality.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With SAEs Through Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with SAEs through Day 29.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With at Least One Grade 3 and Grade 4 Clinical and/or Laboratory Adverse Events Through Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with at least one Grade 3 or Grade 4 clinical and/or laboratory adverse events (AEs) through Day 29.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in WBC With Differential Through Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Collected labs on Days 1 (baseline), 3, 5, 8, and 11 (while hospitalized), Days 15 and 29 (if attends in person visit or still hospitalized). Changes measured as difference between last measured lab value and baseline lab value. A negative value indicates last lab value > baseline lab value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Hemoglobin Measurement Through Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Collected labs on Days 1 (baseline), 3, 5, 8, and 11 (while hospitalized), Days 15 and 29 (if attends in person visit or still hospitalized). Changes measured as difference between last measured lab value and baseline lab value. A negative value indicates last lab value > baseline lab value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Platelets Measurement Through Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Collected labs on Days 1 (baseline), 3, 5, 8, and 11 (while hospitalized), Days 15 and 29 (if attends in person visit or still hospitalized). Changes measured as difference between last measured lab value and baseline lab value. A negative value indicates last lab value > baseline lab value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Creatinine Measurement Through Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Collected labs on Days 1 (baseline), 3, 5, 8, and 11 (while hospitalized), Days 15 and 29 (if attends in person visit or still hospitalized). Changes measured as difference between last measured lab value and baseline lab value. A negative value indicates last lab value > baseline lab value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Glucose Measurement Through Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Collected labs on Days 1 (baseline), 3, 5, 8, and 11 (while hospitalized), Days 15 and 29 (if attends in person visit or still hospitalized). Changes measured as difference between last measured lab value and baseline lab value. A negative value indicates last lab value > baseline lab value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Total Bilirubin Measurement Through Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Collected labs on Days 1 (baseline), 3, 5, 8, and 11 (while hospitalized), Days 15 and 29 (if attends in person visit or still hospitalized). Changes measured as difference between last measured lab value and baseline lab value. A negative value indicates last lab value > baseline lab value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in ALT Measurement Through Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Collected labs on Days 1 (baseline), 3, 5, 8, and 11 (while hospitalized), Days 15 and 29 (if attends in person visit or still hospitalized). Changes measured as difference between last measured lab value and baseline lab value. A negative value indicates last lab value > baseline lab value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in AST Measurement Through Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Collected labs on Days 1 (baseline), 3, 5, 8, and 11 (while hospitalized), Days 15 and 29 (if attends in person visit or still hospitalized). Changes measured as difference between last measured lab value and baseline lab value. A negative value indicates last lab value > baseline lab value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in PT Measurement Laboratory Through Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Collected labs on Days 1 (baseline), 3, 5, 8, and 11 (while hospitalized), Days 15 and 29 (if attends in person visit or still hospitalized). Changes measured as difference between last measured lab value and baseline lab value. A negative value indicates last lab value > baseline lab value.

arm_group.description: COVID-19 Convalescent plasma on Study Day 1 in addition to standard care

intervention.description: 2 units of COVID-19 convalescent plasma compatible with their blood type

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Adult â‰¥18 years of age
2. Laboratory-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection as determined by PCR or other authorized or approved assay in any specimen collected within 72 hours prior to enrollment.
Note - An exception must be requested to the Sponsor if â‰¥72 hours since positive test.
3. Hospitalized in participating facility.
4. Documentation of pneumonia with radiographic evidence of infiltrates by imaging (e.g., chest x-ray or CT scan).
5. Abnormal respiratory status that is judged worse than baseline by the investigator and as documented at any point within 24 hours prior to randomization, consistent with ordinal scale levels 5, 6 or 7, specifically defined as:
- Room air saturation of oxygen (SaO2) < 93%, OR
- Requiring supplemental oxygen, OR
- Tachypnea with respiratory rate â‰¥30
6. Patient or proxy is willing and able to provide written informed consent and comply with all protocol requirements
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Contraindication to transfusion (e.g., severe volume overload, history of severe allergic reaction to blood products), as judged by the investigator.
2. Clinical suspicion that the etiology of acute illness (acute decompensation) is primarily due to a condition other than COVID-19
3. Receipt of other investigational therapy as a part of another clinical trial. Note: investigational therapies used as part of clinical care, (eg, remdesivir, hydroxychloroquine) are permissible.

facility.name: Hospital of the University of Pennsylvania

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

outcome.title: Changes in ALT Measurement Through Day 29
outcome.description: Collected labs on Days 1 (baseline), 3, 5, 8, and 11 (while hospitalized), Days 15 and 29 (if attends in person visit or still hospitalized). Changes measured as difference between last measured lab value and baseline lab value. A negative value indicates last lab value > baseline lab value.
outcome.population: Defined changes as difference between last measured lab value and baseline (day 1) lab value. Day of last measured lab may differ among subjects. Standard of care arm has analyzed sample size of 38 because one subject did not have ALT lab collected

group.title: COVID-19 Convalescent Plasma
group.description: On Day 1 subjects receive 2 units of convalescent plasma collected from ABO-compatible donors who have recovered from COVID-19 followed by standard of care

group.title: Standard of Care
group.description: Standard of care treatment administered only

measure.title: Changes in ALT Measurement Through Day 29
measure.description: Collected labs on Days 1 (baseline), 3, 5, 8, and 11 (while hospitalized), Days 15 and 29 (if attends in person visit or still hospitalized). Changes measured as difference between last measured lab value and baseline lab value. A negative value indicates last lab value > baseline lab value.
measure.population: Defined changes as difference between last measured lab value and baseline (day 1) lab value. Day of last measured lab may differ among subjects. Standard of care arm has analyzed sample size of 38 because one subject did not have ALT lab collected

measure.title: Changes in AST Measurement Through Day 29
measure.description: Collected labs on Days 1 (baseline), 3, 5, 8, and 11 (while hospitalized), Days 15 and 29 (if attends in person visit or still hospitalized). Changes measured as difference between last measured lab value and baseline lab value. A negative value indicates last lab value > baseline lab value.
measure.population: Defined changes as difference between last measured lab value and baseline (day 1) lab value. Day of last measured lab may differ among subjects. Standard of care arm has analyzed sample size of 38 because one subject did not have AST lab collected

outcome.title: Changes in PT Measurement Laboratory Through Day 29
outcome.description: Collected labs on Days 1 (baseline), 3, 5, 8, and 11 (while hospitalized), Days 15 and 29 (if attends in person visit or still hospitalized). Changes measured as difference between last measured lab value and baseline lab value. A negative value indicates last lab value > baseline lab value.
outcome.population: Defined changes as difference between last measured lab value and baseline (day 1) lab value. Day of last measured lab may differ among subjects. Plasma arm analyzed sample size is 38 because 2 subjects did not have PT test collected. Standard of care arm analyzed sample size is 37 because 2 subjects did not have PT test collected.

reported_events.desc: 41 subjects were enrolled in the treatment arm; 1 subject withdrew consent prior to initiate any research activities; Only 40 were placed at risk.

group.title: Treatment
group.description: On Day 1 subjects receive 2 units of convalescent plasma collected from ABO-compatible donors who have recovered from COVID-19 followed by standard of care

group.title: Control
group.description: Standard of care treatment administered only

event.description: Transient ischemic attack; cerebral vascular accident

event.sub_title: Hemoglobin, Low (g/dL; mmol/L) >= 13 years of age (female only)
Hemoglobin, Low (g/dL; mmol/L) >= 13 years of age (male only)
Thrombosis or Embolism Report only one
Pain (not associated with study agent injections and not specified elsewhere)
Calcium, Low (mg/dL; mmol/L) >= 7 days of age
Blood Pressure Abnormalities Hypertension (with the lowest reading taken after repeat testing durin

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
